description: Borrowed from Scots, aphetic form of effect.

examples: I hae been a devil the feck o' my life

verbs.description: feck (third-person singular simple present fecks, present participle fecking, simple past and past participle fecked)

examples: —But why did they run away, tell us?  —I know why, Cecil Thunder said. Because they had fecked cash out of the rector's room.  —Who fecked it?  —Kickham's brother. And they all went shares in it. But that was stealing. How could they have done that?

verbs.description: feck (third-person singular simple present fecks, present participle fecking, simple past and past participle fecked)

entries.meaning: (euphemistic, chiefly Ireland) Alternative form of fuck
examples: Father Jack Hackett: Tea? Feck!  […]  Mrs. Doyle: I'll tell you what, Father. I'll pour a cup for ye anyway and y' can have it if ya want. Now... And what do you say to a cup?Father Jack Hackett: Feck off, cup!
